job_description: GENERAL STATEMENT OF DUTIES:Complete specified projects and tasks within internship or co-op period.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Complete projects as assigned within internship discipline.Attend Raven University sponsored training and educational seminars.Engage and participate in Raven sponsored events.Provide periodic updates to managers and peers on assigned project status.Work closely with assigned mentor to a successful completion of internship.Complete summer end internship presentation.
job_requirements: KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:College student or recent graduate in specified course of study necessary to be successful in defined internship position.Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks simultaneously, without close supervision.Ability to work with high level of confidentiality.Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.Ability to use a computer and software as defined necessary for the internship.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with team members.Ability to troubleshoot and design small electrical circuits using IC's, resistors, capacitors and inductors.Ability to operate troubleshooting equipment such as digital multimeters or oscilloscopes.Ability to develop and troubleshoot circuits which are controlled by a microcontroller/microprocess with programming languages (C, C++, Assembly).WORKING CONDITIONS:Correctional vision, hearing, and speaking ability. Upper and lower body movement required, ability to lift minimum of 50 lb. Required to do initial installations. Mobility to monitor work in production areas.Position requires sitting, standing, walking, bending, reaching, speech and hearing.EOE AA M/F/Vet/DisabilityKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:College student or recent graduate in specified course of study necessary to be successful in defined internship position.Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks simultaneously, without close supervision.Ability to work with high level of confidentiality.Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.Ability to use a computer and software as defined necessary for the internship.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with team members.Ability to troubleshoot and design small electrical circuits using IC's, resistors, capacitors and inductors.Ability to operate troubleshooting equipment such as digital multimeters or oscilloscopes.Ability to develop and troubleshoot circuits which are controlled by a microcontroller/microprocess with programming languages (C, C++, Assembly).WORKING CONDITIONS:Correctional vision, hearing, and speaking ability. Upper and lower body movement required, ability to lift minimum of 50 lb. Required to do initial installations. Mobility to monitor work in production areas.Position requires sitting, standing, walking, bending, reaching, speech and hearing.EOE AA M/F/Vet/DisabilityOpen To All Majors:No
